name: Long-Form Post (Expanded Outline)
description: Expand a proven outline into a deep-dive long-form LinkedIn post with hook, introduction (PAS format), main points as complete sections, and CTA. Use after testing outline version.
use_when: Outline version got strong engagement and you want to go deeper
Topic requires tactical depth that a list can't deliver
Teaching a framework or process step-by-step
Sharing a story with multiple lessons
Establishing thought leadership with comprehensive insights

hook.format: First 200 characters visible before 'See more' button
hook.purpose: Stop scroll + create cliffhanger that demands the click
requirements: Must end with cliffhanger (tease 'the one mistake' or 'what happened next')
Create curiosity gap reader needs to close
examples: I just watched a new investor lose a $200K deal because of this one critical financing mistake:
Most founders think posting daily is the secret. I posted daily for 90 days and lost money. Here's what actually worked:

problem.purpose: Identify the specific problem reader faces
problem.example: Most first-time rental investors focus on finding the perfect property but completely ignore the financing piece.

agitate.purpose: Make the cost of inaction clear and urgent
agitate.example: These mistakes cost thousands of dollars and months of wasted time—some kill deals that would have been profitable for decades.

solve.purpose: Promise the solution you're about to deliver
solve.example: Today, I'm sharing the 5 most common financing mistakes and exactly how to avoid each one.

header.purpose: Deliver 80% of section value in header alone
header.requirement: Skimmable - reader gets insight without reading body

opening_line.purpose: Hook reader into THIS specific section
opening_line.guideline: Use any of the 5 hook types (stat, story, question, etc.)

tactical_content.format: Actionable information using 10 magical ways (tips, reasons, steps, etc.)

conclusion.example: Skip this step and you'll waste months on properties you can never close.

depth_vs_breadth.fewer_sections: More depth per section (300-500 words each)

cta.format: Question that invites engagement OR guides to content library
cta.placement: In post body (no links) OR in first comment (if link required)
examples: Which of these mistakes have you made? (asking for a friend)
What would you add to this list?
Want the full financing checklist? Link in comments.
forbidden: Do NOT put opt-in/website links in post body (LinkedIn penalizes)
If link needed, say 'Link in comments' and add as first comment

quality_criteria.description: First 200 chars stop scroll + create cliffhanger
Introduction promises X sections, body delivers exactly X
Reader can skim headers and get 80% of value
Short paragraphs, clear structure, easy to skim

forbidden_patterns: Don't bury the lede - deliver hook promise in headers
Don't write long paragraphs (max 3-4 lines per paragraph)
Don't promise 5 sections and deliver 3 or 7
Don't put links in post body (comment instead)
Don't skip the PAS introduction - it sells the read
examples:
Hook: 'I just watched a new investor lose a $200K deal because of this one critical financing mistake:'

Intro (PAS): Problem → Agitate → Solve

Mistake #1: Not getting pre-approved
[Opening hook for this section]
[3-5 tactical points]
[One-sentence conclusion]

Mistake #2: Using credit cards for down payment
[Continue pattern...]

CTA: Which mistake have you made?
agent_instructions: This template is for EXPANDING a proven outline that already got engagement. Agent should: 1) Reference the outline that performed well, 2) Expand each list item into a full section with hook/tactics/conclusion, 3) Use brand voice and company_documents for tactical depth, 4) Apply PAS format to introduction. DO NOT ask user for outline - pull from content_examples table if mentioned or infer structure from topic.
